content: |-

   At the heart of the forest, beneath a gnarled oak, Alden found the source of the curse: a crystal orb pulsing with black mist. As he approached, a specter of

   Light burst forth, bathing the forest in golden hues. Trees unfurled fresh leaves, and the sickly fog dissolved like a dream at dawn. The kingdom rejoiced, a

   Sir Alden's legend endured not because he wielded a mighty sword, but because his bravery was rooted in humility and love for his people. And when the wind r
